result.title: Evaluation of E2E 5G infrastructure and service slices, and of the developed self-learning ML algorithms
result.description: D43 will report on the integration between the 5GCLARITY SDNNFV platform and an E2E 5G service platform and will evaluate the time required to instantiate E2E infrastructureservice slices combining resources located inside the private venue with resources owned by the MNO In addition this deliverable will report on the final design andevaluation of the selflearning ML algorithms designed to manage the 5GCLARITY infrastructure

result.title: Validation of 5G-CLARITY SDN/NFV platform, interface design with 5G service platform, and initial definition of evaluation of ML algorithms
result.description: D42 will provide a validation of the SDNNFV platform that allows to instantiate infrastructure slices and connectivity services inside the private venue To benchmark the platform D42 will evaluate the time required to instantiate a slice and a service In addition D42 will describe how the infrastructureservice slices instantiated inside the private venue can be connected to a 5G service platform Finally this deliverable will describe the initial implementation and evaluation of ML algorithms to manage the 5GCLARITY networkcompute infrastructure

result.title: Presentation of ALARM tailored products.
result.description: This Deliverable will contain a cover page with the title of the deliverable deliverable number project information acronym grant number call topic consortium coordinator information edition date and number authoring and approval data sheet with the names of the authors reviewers internal to the project approval by PC Task Leader and WP Leader eventual rejection by any representative of the beneficiaries and document history the abstract of ALARM project An executive summary of the Deliverable highlighting the contributions main results and conclusions and some insight on how this deliverable will be feeding other tasks within the project An introduction to the topic including the motivation and goals of the deliverable the methodological approach to the conduction of Task 22 Implementation of data platform of ALARM EWS Task 23 Architecture of ALARM EWS and Task 24 Implementation of risk area and ATM products the results derived from these tasks Concluding remarks
